io.confluent.ksql.test.util

Class EmbeddedSingleNodeKafkaCluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • io.confluent.ksql.test.util.EmbeddedSingleNodeKafkaCluster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    public final class EmbeddedSingleNodeKafkaCluster
extends org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
    Runs an in-memory, "embedded" Kafka cluster with 1 ZooKeeper instance and 1 Kafka broker.

      • bootstrapServers

        public java.lang.String bootstrapServers()
        This cluster's `bootstrap.servers` value. Example: `127.0.0.1:9092`.

        You can use this to tell Kafka producers how to connect to this cluster.

      • bootstrapServers

        public java.lang.String bootstrapServers(org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.SecurityProtocol securityProtocol)
        This cluster's `bootstrap.servers` value. Example: `127.0.0.1:9092`.

        You can use this to tell Kafka producers how to connect to this cluster.

        Parameters:
        securityProtocol - the security protocol to select.

      • getClientProperties

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getClientProperties()
        Common properties that clients will need to connect to the cluster.

        This includes any SASL / SSL related settings.

        Returns:
        the properties that should be added to client props.

      • zookeeperConnect

        public java.lang.String zookeeperConnect()
        This cluster's ZK connection string aka `zookeeper.connect` in `hostnameOrIp:port` format. Example: `127.0.0.1:2181`.

        You can use this to e.g. tell Kafka consumers how to connect to this cluster.

        Returns:
        the map of produced rows, with an iteration order that matches produce order.
